data.title: Added a setting to change the line number color
data.body: Added a setting to change the line number color.

data.title: 3d pan/zoom without middle mouse button should be optional
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Ubuntu

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/4241 introduced ability to pan/zoom in 3d editor without middle mouse button, by simply holding shift/ctrl keys. Unfortunately this pr changes the way how panning/zooming is working for people that do have mouse and touchpad (or stylus) in the same time.
So it seems there should be an option in settings to turn on/off this functionality. 
Edit: It looks this behaviour is common for all users, independently if there is touchpad/stylus available or not.
**Steps to reproduce:**
**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Updated nrex to v0.2
data.body:
More updates I've made to https://github.com/leezh/nrex
- Fixed capturing groups matching to invalid results
- Fixed parents of recursive quantifiers not expanding properly
- Fixed LookAhead sometimes adding to result

Unit tests should ensure no breakages, but it's a bit limited at the moment. If anything breaks or isn't working do let me know and I'll add it to the test cases.

data.title: AnimationPlayer relative positions
data.body:
Hello!
I feel AnimationPlayer is missing a "relative position" feature.
To be more clear: the actual location of the animation would be relative to the
local position instead of the absolute world position.

For instance, it would allow to create platforms that move in a circular pattern without remaking the animation every time for each platform.

It surely can be obtained with Tween but is not as immediate and user friendly as it would be
to have it in the AnimationPlayer directly.

Which would be the most elegant way to implement it?

data.title: _get_alloc_size_checked behavior
data.body:
during initialization, there's a call to "_get_alloc_size_checked(6, &alloc_size)", which is returning "true", but the value stored in alloc_size is 0. This is on Vector<T>::resize() (line 277). The alloc size 0 is causing the function to return with ERR_OUT_OF_MEMORY.

Only happens on a release build (debug works), with a clang compiler.

Could this be the cause of the ios issue?

data.title: Improving SamplePlayer delay when playing a sound
data.body:
**Operating system or device:** Windows 7 x86_64 with Godot Engine 2.1 (Steam version)

**Issue description** I'm making a rythm game, and when a note is played, a "hitsound" is played. But, the sound isn't sync'ed with the user input. I searched on the web and I found that there are a latency with the audio of Godot engine.

So, maybe add a way to have a pre-buffered SamplePlayer and modifiying the audio server for near 0 latency, or just improving latency with SamplePlayer and every audio-related stuff.

**Steps to reproduce:** A SamplePlayer configured with a little sound. Set input processing to true and when a key is pressed, play the sound.

**Link to minimal example project** [Mega.nz](https://mega.nz/#!Lto22IbJ!U8u9PSpqEiukhxmAL3JayP9t1iGz0FGDZCP-7Fyw730) (press the space key for playing the sound)

data.title: CollisionPolygon2D not updating when debugging collisions
data.body:
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Changing a the points/segments of a _Convex/ConcavePolygonShape2D_ during the game should update the shape if _Visible Collision Shapes_ is enabled. It works fine with _CollisionShape2D_ but not with _CollisionPolygon2D_.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Enable _Visible Collision Shapes_ option and change the shape points/segments in game:

``` GDScript
var shape = body.get_shape(0)
var points = shape.get_points()
points[0] = Vector2(0, points[0].y - 10)
shape.set_points(points)
```

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[SP_4260.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/208556/SP_4260.zip)

Run the game with _Visible Collision Shapes_ enabled and click the _Change_ button:

![Screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/14354797/fc97fd14-fcde-11e5-9557-a2aad2a62b4d.png)

data.title: Fix RayCast not updating when debugging collissions
data.body: Fixes #4224

data.title: Avoid selecting items from instanced scenes in CanvasItemEditorPlugin
data.body:
This behaviour is only applied to click selection. Rect selection and List selection can still select these items.

To make it clear: the old behaviour was that you couldn't this items either, but if you selected over their item rect the owner (the instanced scene root) was selected instead. This was very annoying, specially when overriding `_get_item_rect` in the owner's script if it has a child with a greater rect.

data.title: Fix warn print when hide an control does not inside_tree
Fix crash when tween control object previous freed
Change default Node2d select-area size
data.body:
Hello, everyone! I've been enjoying Godot and am very impressed and loving it. Thanks to all those putting their hard work into it. I searched through the issues and it seems no-one's requested this in particular. I hope so, anyway!

So, onto the problem/feature request: it seems certain nodes (I think it's node2d and everything that inherits it that has no specific size attribute -- kinematic body, area2d, etc.) have a default select-area size of 64x64 px in the editor. This is the area that you can select objects in the editor, and it seems there's no way to change this size.

![select_area](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18315399/14334423/0197eaa6-fc1a-11e5-9f0f-9ca1ff5690ae.png)

(The player root node shown above is a kinematic body, but again, it seems it's many nodes with this default, non-change-able size) As you can see above, in a low resolution game where every object is based on 16x16 tile-size, this makes selecting and arranging objects in the editor difficult (though the drop-down select tool helps). It would be super helpful to be able to set these node select-areas to something that fits the game you're making -- 16x16 in this case.

**The feature**, then: would it be possible to add a field in project settings marked, maybe, "set default node select size", and you could set a width/height there? That way if you're working on a game based around 16x16 tile-size you could type that in, and all of these kinds of nodes would have that size, allowing you to move and select and align things with no problem. Or maybe even just a way to set this kind of thing on a node-by-node basis, though I think just having a default you could set would be helpful enough!

Thanks again in advance, and I hope I'm doing this right.

data.title: Testing game from 2nd monitor crash
data.body:
I have a 3 monitor setup on my iMac:
iMac itself, Cintiq, and another monitor.
When I start the Godot editor, and drag the window to a different monitor, then press Play icon on top to test my game, the game crashes immediately:

```
Exception Type:        EXC_BAD_ACCESS (SIGSEGV)
Exception Codes:       KERN_INVALID_ADDRESS at 0x0000000063614d2f
```

If I drag the editor window back to the first monitor, and launch the game - it works fine.

data.title: Option to toggle syntax highlighting
data.body: Can now toggle syntax highlighting in the text editor.

data.title: Refactoring suggestion: making GDScript an own library
data.body:
Another wild suggestion: It seems like some people are reluctant to use GDScript for the reason that they can't reuse it elsewhere.

So why not make it its own library so they actually can reuse it in their own engines or games? They'd even have game specific functionality, like built in vector types.

I guess that'd require
- [ ] moving/generalizing too Godot-specific features
- [ ] packaging it
- [ ] ???
- [ ] profit

As mentioned in the particle issue, I'm not even using Godot atm, so, yeah, I'm quite the Idea Guy™ here, sorry.

data.title: Fixed block indent inconsistency, issue #3803
data.body: Fixed block indent inconsistency, closes #3803. It now works similar to sublime text and intellij.

data.title: Enhanced 2D and 3D particle system & tooling
data.body:
It's a wild suggestion so feel free to ignore, but having more types of particle emitters would probably be cool. (It's also weird there isn't already a ticket for that, but I guess good particle effects are generally underestimated in games.)

Like beam emitters with startpos, endpos, trails, trail-fading, beam-fading and intense and zappynes (like for lightening bolts) parameters, or mesh emitters.

For example, check out [this](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OXK2Xbd7D9w) video.

As for the editor, a tool/stamp to group emitters would be awesome where included emitters could auto-inherit some parameters like lifetimes from. Imagine that for explosions, where you typically have fire, sparks, smoke and debris particles.

Note that I'm not even using Godot atm; I just think it would be a really cool feature to have for a game engine and it's probably a PITA to add manually afterwards. So if you got the time and motivation, why not.

data.title: filepath problem
data.body:
in release mode, the program does not read ../ word

```
if tempfile.file_exists("res://resources/folderA/a7.bme/../a7.bme"):
    print("exists!")
else:
    print("not exists!")

```

in debug mode, this code prints exist!
in release, prints not exists!

data.title: Bind Z key (without modifiers) to toggle wireframe in 3D view
data.body: Fixes #4124

data.title: Add binding to append_array for RAW_ARRAY
data.body:
This is useful for merging two arrays. 
The method is already there, so I just added the binding to use it from GDScript.

data.title: Fixes camera switching error.
data.body: This just fixes a relatively harmless set of errors which would occur when switching from a scene with a canvas editor to a scene with a spatial editor. Since the camera is updated in the process loop, calls to update the camera in the renderer would get called before the camera position had a chance to be calculated, resulting in some errors being printed to the console, and this simply address it by pre-emptively updating the camera whenever the spatial editor's visibility is updated.

data.title: Enhancement: Ctrl-up/down to scroll text whilst maintaining current line
data.body:
(If this has been discussed before, apologies.)

It would be great if Ctrl-Up/Ctrl-Down would scroll the script code up/down while retaining the cursor/caret line position as per Notepad++, Visual Studio and most other editors.

Top/bottom of screen behaviour: my personal preference is that, like the mentioned editors, the caret position stays at the top or bottom of screen, respectively, when the caret line scrolls off the top/bottom of the editor window. It's just what I'm used to after many years of using VS. This is **unlike** VS Code (for example) where the caret position goes into 'virtual' space, such that when you stop scrolling, the view 'jumps' to the location in the code where the caret ended up. To me this is annoying behaviour that removes some of the usefulness of the feature. Android Studio (and I guess by extension IntelliJ IDEA) behaves like VS Code. I think Eclipse and others do as well.

data.title: Fixed text edit undo and redo operation interaction
data.body: Fixes the undo and redo interaction with the text editor operations such as toggle comments, indent right, indent left e.t.c as mentioned [here](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4198#issuecomment-205062696) and [here.](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3803#issuecomment-189211158)

data.title: Added rotation/panning support for trackpads in 3D mode #53
data.body: Users can now rotate/pan/zoom based upon the key-bindings available in the settings even if they only have a trackpad. Closes #53

data.title: TSCN bug when exporting path to an image
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Mageia 5

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
tscn format saves the whole content of the image targetted by an exported path variable inputted to a script, into the tscn file, bloating it up. Should simply export the path instead.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download this project's zip : https://github.com/StraToN/godot_pointandclickadv/releases/tag/v0.1
2. Open the project in Godot editor (scene file is /Assets/rooms/desk/desk.scn)
3. Directly save the scene as *.tscn

The output tscn is ~15 Mb. 
Godot seems to export the content of the depth.png image which path is provided as a parameter to the "bg" node, instead of the provided path.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://github.com/StraToN/godot_pointandclickadv/releases/tag/v0.1

**Details**
The corresponding exported image is located in the Assets/terrain.gd script.

data.title: Adding "Quick open" for scenes and scripts
data.body:
As my game project grows in size, I found myself navigating too often in files to open what I'm searching for. Tabs are okay, but at some point, I end up not using them so much.
So, just like Sublime Text, Atom or Visual Assist, why not adding a quick-open command triggered with a shortcut, to open files or scripts just by knowing a part of their path?
And if it's not a priority for the editor, how can it be added by extending it with a script?

EDIT: Oops, I found it actually exists for scripts with Ctrl+Alt+O, and for any file with Ctrl+Alt+P. But the latter doesn't opens the scene/script, it just locates it in the file system.

data.title: Ability to change the caret color
data.body: Added a setting to change the colour of the caret.

data.title: Swift/Objective-c Support for IOS project?
data.body:
on IOS export, the godot engine has been compiled into godot_opt.iphone file.
but there is not entry file for Objective-c/swfit,
For example, when you want to add push notification function,  admob, or google analytics function, if you want to use some cocoa component or code, how can you do that?
